Function Documentation

void sw_set ( iu16  value  ) 

Function for setting sw.

This function reduces the code size on the AVR architecture.

Referenced by auth_checkAc(), auth_createVerifyCryptogram(), auth_getChallenge(), auth_getCheckPinLen(), auth_verifyPin(), cmd_changeUnblockPIN(), cmd_create(), cmd_delete(), cmd_extAuth(), cmd_getChallenge(), cmd_getResponse(), cmd_intAuth(), cmd_read(), cmd_readBinary(), cmd_select(), cmd_updateBinary(), cmd_verifyKeyPIN(), cmd_write(), fs_create(), fs_delete(), fs_getFPath(), fs_seek(), fstream_test(), hal_eeprom_read(), hal_eeprom_write(), t0_testP1P2(), t0_testP3(), ta_commit(), and ta_setdata().

Variable Documentation

iu16 sw

Status word returned by functions.

The state of sw is undefined, on return value TRUE.

The content of this variable is returned at the end of the command interpreter loop. Functions falled from the command interpreter loop should set it to SW_OK if they return without error.

Referenced by auth_getCheckPinLen(), main(), and t0_sendSw().
